rules.text: No discrimination -- including racism, sexism, homophobia or transphobia.
No incitement of violence or promotion of violent ideologies.
No impersonation of a person or brand.  Even parodies.
Spam. Don't join if you just want to spam links to things you represent.
No attacking or pentesting of this instance, or any other instance.
Each username on here should be a person, not a brand or corporation - and that person must be you, no impersonation.
Do not join to primarily publicise or promote 'red team' tools.
Do not use this server to promote how to attack the Fediverse via OSINT, exploits etc.
No posting identifiable personal information from data breaches.

records.text: I don't know how to feel about the release of #JulianAssange. On the one hand, freedom is great. But the price of that was admitting "guilt". Not a real victory for #press freedom IMHO.The years in high-security prison have been retroactively declared as the punishment for "espionage".They successfully punished a whistleblower AND got away with it, which will absolutely make other whistleblowers think twice. The state has won, the people have lost.#Assange #freedom #prison

records.text: As for flags, I've basically seen the same flags as last year (but it's a LOT). I like how there is not just the "classic rainbow flag" 🏳️‍🌈, but also flags for every identity, like gay, lesbian, bi, trans, enby, demigender. And, of course, aromantic and asexual. My flags! 🙂 The stereotype this is all just a Tumblr trend quickly falls apart when you see it IRL. 😉These flags aren't just random colors for teh lulz. They *stand* for something. Every single one of them.

Every single one of them.
